case_title: ABDUL NABI and others vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary Education, Quetta and others
respondant: GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary Education, Quetta and others
complaint_summary: Appellants challenged the termination of their services as teachers based on allegations of fake appointment orders without being given notice or opportunity to defend themselves.
investigation_summary: An inquiry committee found the appointment orders and service books of the appellants to be fake. The inquiry was conducted unilaterally without issuing show-cause notices or providing an opportunity for the appellants to defend themselves.
judgment_summary: The court remanded the case to the Secretary Education Balochistan for reconsideration and disposal of appellants' representations within three months, citing violations of natural justice and procedural requirements under the Balochistan Province Removal from Service (Special Powers) Ordinance, 2000.
legal_arguments: Violation of natural justice (audi alteram partem)
Failure to conduct proper inquiry as per Section 5 of the Balochistan Province Removal from Service (Special Powers) Ordinance, 2000
statutes: Balochistan Province Removal from Service (Special Powers) Ordinance, 2000
witnesses: Haji Abdul Manan (Deputy Director of Education)

witness_statement.Haji Abdul Manan: Conducted inquiry and found appointment orders and service books fake.
witness_statement.Haji Abdul Ghaffar Khudazai: Assisted in inquiry confirming fraudulent documents.

maxims.audi alteram partem: No one should be condemned unheard.

legal_terms.Natural Justice: Principles ensuring fair treatment in legal proceedings.
legal_terms.Show-cause notice: A notice requiring explanation before action is taken.

words_and_phrases.Miscarriage of justice: Failure to achieve a fair outcome in legal proceedings.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves termination of 119 teachers based on allegations of fake appointment orders without due process. Court remanded the matter for reconsideration citing violations of natural justice and procedural requirements under relevant statutes.
